== Biography ==

'''Susan Augusta Bond''' was born on 2 April 1852 in Jefferson County, Iowa.<ref>Birth date and place from family records; see Serfling compilation.</ref> She was the daughter of '''[[Bond-1462|Solomon Bond]]''' and '''[[Hayes-2388|Huldah (Hayes) Bond]]'''.

In 1853, when Susan was just a year old, her parents joined the great westward migration, traveling the Oregon Trail to settle in the Willamette Valley. The Bond family established themselves in Linn County, Oregon, where Solomon and Huldah became respected pioneers.

Susan married '''Alanson Lawson Bridgefarmer''', also from a prominent Oregon pioneer family. Together they had at least one daughter:

* '''Huldah Imogene Bridgefarmer''' (1873â€“1907), who married George Washington Kuthe

Susan died on 2 December 1886 in Linn County, Oregon, at the age of 34.<ref>Death date and place from family records.</ref> She did not live to see her daughter Imogene marry or meet her grandchildren.

== Research Notes ==

The birth location appears in some records as simply "Iowa" and in others as "Jefferson, Iowa." Jefferson County, Iowa is the likely intended location.
